summary: What happens if you lose track of some of your retirement funds—such as a 401(k) from a prior employer? The companies holding those unclaimed accounts can take the money out and transfer it to states. States hold the money as lost property until the owners claim it. But whenever money comes out of a tax-deferred account, there are taxes to consider. We looked at how...
title: Retirement Accounts: Federal Action Needed to Clarify Tax Treatment of Unclaimed 401(k) Plan Savings Transferred to States
